p: The United Kingdom (U.K.) government followed Healthâ€™s Department direct recommendations for travelling abroad with respiratory infections, especially travelling to Wuhan [ 33]. The U.K. National Health Service emphasized the importance of using personal protective equipment, obtaining a detailed history of travelling, and rapidly escalating suspicious cases with a dedication to isolate patients. Any confirmed cases of COVID-19 should be moved to an airborne high impact infectious disease center such as the two major centers in England (Royal Free Hospital in London and Newcastle Royal Victoria Infirmary). U.K. Chief Medical Officers told individuals who had toured Wuhan or Hubei Province over the past 14 days to stay at home and call National Health Service number 111. Such recommendations were also applied to people, who have visited Japan, Thailand, Hong Kong, Singapore, Taiwan, Macau, and Malaysia [ 34].
